sentences.en: "Prices are down 40 per cent since Christmas," he lamented.
sentences.cn: “圣诞节以来物价降了4成，”他悲叹道。

sentences.en: 20 to 40 per cent of the voters are undecided.
sentences.cn: 20%到40%的选民还犹豫不决。

sentences.en: Admission is £9.95 per adult.
sentences.cn: 成人门票每位9.95英镑。

sentences.en: Bank base rates of 7 per cent are too high.
sentences.cn: 7%的银行基准利率太高了。

sentences.en: Calls cost 36p (cheap rate) and 48p (peak rate) per minute.
sentences.cn: 电话每分钟36便士（优惠费率）和48便士（高峰费率）。

sentences.en: Costs have been cut by 30 to 50 per cent.
sentences.cn: 成本降低了30%到50%。

sentences.en: He pronounced it Per-sha, the way the English do.
sentences.cn: 他像英格兰人那样将它读成Per-sha。

sentences.en: How much does it cost per kilo?
sentences.cn: 每公斤多少钱？

sentences.en: In general, incumbents have a 94 per cent chance of being reelected.
sentences.cn: 通常现任官员有94%的几率会再次当选。

sentences.en: Most of our flights have a baggage allowance of 44lbs per passenger.
sentences.cn: 我们大多数航班行李限重为每位乘客44磅。

sentences.en: My car does 12 miles per litre (= for each litre of petrol ) .
sentences.cn: 我的汽车每升汽油跑12英里。

sentences.en: rooms costing £40 per night
sentences.cn: 每晚收费40英镑的房间

sentences.en: Somalia, pop. 7.9 million, income per head about £1.60 a week.
sentences.cn: 索马里，人口790万，人均收入大约每周1.60英镑。

sentences.en: The bank yesterday revealed a 30 per cent nosedive in profits.
sentences.cn: 该银行昨天透露其利润骤降30％。

sentences.en: The economy needs an immediate 2 per cent cut in interest rates.
sentences.cn: 当前经济状况需要立即将利率下调两个百分点.

sentences.en: The meal cost $25 per head (= for or by each person ) .
sentences.cn: 那顿饭人均花费25美元。

sentences.en: The park attracts four million visitors per year.
sentences.cn: 那座公园每年吸引400万游客。

sentences.en: The quota of four tickets per person had been reduced to two.
sentences.cn: 每人可购买的票的限额已经由四张降至两张。

sentences.en: The vehicles have a top speed of 80 kilometres per hour.
sentences.cn: 这些车辆最高时速为80公里。

sentences.en: They have been per-suaded of the merits of peace.
sentences.cn: 他们被劝服，认识到了和平的好处。

sentences.en: Today's RPI figure shows inflation running at 10.9 per cent.
sentences.cn: 今天的零售物价指数显示通货膨胀率为10.9％。

phrases.tran_cn: 人均；（拉丁）每人；按人口计算

trans.tran_cn: 由，（表示根据）依照，（表示比率）（尤指数量，价格，时间）每
